item.title: Kubectl alias
item.description: Play with kubernets at ease! Alias? What,Why ðŸ¤” An alias is a (usually short) name that the shell translates into another (usually longer) name or command. Aliases allow you to define new commands by substituting a string for the first token of a simple command. It can be used to avoid typing long commands or as a means to correct incorrect input. For common patterns it can reduce keystrokes and improve efficiency.
